comments:
Build ID: I20070209-1006

Steps To Reproduce:
This appeared once, I could not reproduce it after restarting the workbench.
It appeared first when opening a Java class out of the Open Type dialog (but afterwards always when trying to open an editor). I already worked a while but at the moment the error occurred only 5 editors where open.

More information:
Suse Linux Enterprise Desktop 10
GTK: 2.8.10-39.22
Gnome: 2.12.2

Bogdan and SN to check all references to Callback to ensure we are not leaking.

We went through all of our references to Callback. They were all either ok in that they had a corresponding dispose part, or that they were static instances. The only way we can see leaking is by creating multiple displays.

Here are the results in detail:

Device:
XErrorCallback - ok (static)
XIOErrorCallback - ok (static)
logCallback (ok)

Display:
fixedClassInitCallback - ok (static)
fixedMapCallback - ok (static)
rendererClassInitCallback - ok (static)
rendererRenderCallback - ok (static)
rendererGetSizeCallback - ok (static)
eventCallback (ok)
filterCallback (ok)
windowCallback2 (ok)
windowCallback3 (ok)
windowCallback4 (ok)
windowCallback5 (ok)
timerCallback (ok)
windowTimerCallback (ok)
mouseHoverCallback (ok)
caretCallback (ok)
menuPositionCallback (ok)
sizeAllocateCallback (ok)
shellMapCallback (ok)
treeSelectionCallback (ok)
cellDataCallback (ok)
setDirectionCallback (ok)
checkIfEventCallback (ok)
idleCallback (ok)
styleSetCallback (ok)

Accessibility: (all callbacks) - ok (static)

ClipboardProxy:
getFunc (ok) (singleton)
clearFunc (ok) (singleton)

DND:
DragGetData - ok (static)
DragEnd - ok (static)
DragDataDelete - ok (static)
Drag_Motion - ok (static)
Drag_Leave - ok (static)
Drag_Data_Received - ok (static)
Drag_Drop - ok (static)

XPCOMObject: (all callbacks) - ok (static)

MozillaDelegate: (all callbacks) - ok (static)

PrinterDialog:
printSettingsCallback (ok)

Printer:
getDefaultPrinterData() - printerCallback (ok)
getPrinterList() - printerCallback (ok)
gtkPrinterFromPrinterData() - printerCallback (ok)

On GTK, multiple instances of class Display whose lifetimes overlap is not allowed (should throw an error).  It should not be possible to create a new display without disposing the old one.

Given this, I can't see how we are leaking.  The only thing I can suggest is putting a count in callback creation and watching it to see if we are wrong.
